The total awesomeness over all contiguous subarrays can be computed by noting that the awesomeness of a subarray [l, r] is 1 (for the first element) plus 1 for every index i (from l to r-1) such that a[i] ! = a[i+1].

Therefore, the awesomeness for a subarray [l, r] is: 1 + (number of indices i in [l, r-1] where a[i] ! = a[i+1]). Then the total sum over all subarrays is:
  = (number of subarrays) + (for each adjacent pair (i, i+1) where a[i]!=a[i+1], count the number of subarrays that include this adjacent pair)

The number of subarrays is n*(n+1)//2. For an adjacent pair at (i, i+1) that is a boundary (i.e., a[i]!=a[i+1]), the number of subarrays that include this boundary is:
